five dashes arranged as quincunx (like fivespot on dice)
stylized flower or florette
use for stylized flower or florette or hollow-centered five-point asterisk
horizontal (or lazy) double dagger (pointing neither left nor right)
heart-shaped symbol

Greek and Syriac critical siglum as used by Origen and his successors. This is a glyph variant of the generic OBELUS entity (U+2E13) (horizontal line with dot above), which may in some examples have distinctive meaning. Display as mathematical DOT MINUS.

Greek and Syriac critical siglum as used by Origen and his successors. This is a glyph variant of the generic OBELUS entity (U+2E13) (horizontal line with dot below), which may in some examples have distinctive meaning. Display as the Syriac derivative (SYRIAC HARKLEAN OBELUS; but may need to change this because of RTL property of Syriac)
inverted dagger (blade up, hilt down)
use only when need to distinguish from generic cross, Cp. cross and dagger
left dagger (blade left, hilt right) found in E000392 REF 11
Left-pointing Greek diple, display as quotation mark. For dotted diples add dots. consider reassigning this to U+2329
stylized leaf

Greek and Syriac critical siglum as used by Origen and his successors. This is a glyph variant of the generic OBELUS entity (U+2E13) (horizontal line with dot above and below), which may in some examples have distinctive meaning. Display as division sign.

Greek and Syriac critical siglum as used by Origen and his successors. This is the generic entity, to be used regardless of glyph variant or when glyph variation is insignificant. Glyph variants may look like ÷ (division) or ∸ (dot minus) or ∻ (homothetic). Our only attested example actually looks like none of these, but like a 'stair step' similar in shape to the 'right transposition bracket' (⸊)
quad dot square (without specific meaning; compare proportion entity)
quad dot leaning left (without specific meaning). Displays as alternating high dots and periods (full stops).
quad dot leaning right (without specific meaning) Displays as alternating high dots and periods (full stops).
right dagger (blade right, hilt left) ound in E000392 REF 11

Right-pointing Greek diple, display as quotation mark. For dotted diples either add dots separately or use ddiple. consider reassigning this to U+232A. Added complication: only clear example actually calls it an obelus (!)
reversed (mirror-image) section symbol
Used chiefly to capture the baseline small plus sign used by early printers as a glyph variant of the punctus (period or full stop).
triple dagger (one vertical bar, three shorter evenly spaced cross-bars)
common club-headed dingbat with bent or hook- or sickle-shaped stalk, presumably a clover or trefoil but conceivably something else entirely.
two apostrophes and a comma arranged like dtridot without specific meaning

equiv.desc: ONE DOT OVER TWO DOTS PUNCTUATION

char.comment: three dots forming an upright triangle, like therefore symbol but without that meaning, note that tridot also exists in ISOamsb, but with reference to completely different symbol
last in a series of marginal quotation marks (used only by keyers, removed in review)
Intended for rotated pilcrow (i.e. normal pilcrow sort used upside-down); not in Unicode. Displays as reversed pilcrow instead.
For display purposes substitute the ornamental medium left curly brace in place of the true brace, reserved for abbreviation expansions.
display equivalent changed from curly-bracketed string to UTF8 2013-07 pfs
reversed (mirror-image) question mark. Resembles lpunctel but serves as query mark, not as opening bracketing punctuation; cf. INVERTED QUESTION MARK ¿
fallback character for ambiguous dot-like punctuation marks that could be : . , ; etc.
punctus elevatus (inverted and reversed semicolon, similar to question mark)
For display purposes substitute the ornamental medium right curly brace in place of the true brace, reserved for abbreviation expansions.
first in a series of marginal quotation marks (used only by keyers, removed in review)
span deliberately left blank, to be filled in by hand, as in a legal form
Proofreader's CLOSE or JOIN mark. Semantically probably anachronistic in TCP texts but used for its shape.
Earth, for alchemical antimony, see separate entity (treated under same codepoint by Unicode)
Jupiter, or alchemical tin
Mars, or alchemical iron
planet or alchemical mercury (the metal)
Prefer the disambiguous entites Moonfirst, Moonlast, Moonnew, Moonround. Generic symbol for Moon (planet) or alchemical silver, currently displays as first quarter moon (as does Moonfirst).
or alchemical lead
or alchemical gold
Formal variant of SUN
Venus, or alchemical copper
0 degrees. Unicode assigns "Alchemical symbol for day" to this codepoint too, but TCP has separated them.
first quarter moon calendrical symbol, curve to the right, points to the left; also used for alchemical silver; see also Moonlast, Moonnew, Moonround
last quarter moon calendrical symbol, curve to the left, points to the right; see also Moonfirst, Moonnew, Moonround
new moon calendrical symbol, most often depicted by black circle; see also Moonfirst, Moonlast, Moonround
full moon calendrical symbol, most often depicted by white circle; see also Moonfirst, Moonlast, Moonnew
dragon's head. Unicode assigns 'Alchemical symbol for sublimate' to this codepoint as well, when the glyph is so used. TCP prefers to separate sublim- as a separate character, regardless of glyph
180 degrees
hollow square used as symbol for quadrine or quartile or quadrant or quadrature, 90 degrees
astrological symbol for semisextile, 30 degrees. Display as U+22BB
astrological symbol for sextile, 60 degrees. Display as U+2736.
dragon's tail. Unicode assigns 'Alchemical symbol for purify' to this codepoint as well, when the the glyph is so used. TCP prefers to separate purify as a separate character, regardless of glyph
astrological symbol for trine, 120 degrees, Unicode equivalent with WHITE UP-POINTING TRIANGLE
alternative 3-spoke version of symbol for trine, Cp. trine, halfcross
asterisk used to mean star in astronomical texts, special use of ast entity, Cp. ast
cross with left arm removed. Cp. trine2, trine
cross with right arm removed. Cp. halfcross
dra(ch)m, Unicode treats as equivalent with LATIN SMALL LETTER EZH; TCP treats separately
abbreviation symbol for 'precipi' or 'precipite / -ation'
abbreviation symbol for 'subli' or 'sublimation'
alchemical or medical sign for aqua fortis: resembles a stylized conjoined AF
alchemical symbol for air (upright open triangle divided by horizontal line).
alchemical sign for alembic; resembles inverted capital A or (alternative glyph) superimposed inverted A and normal V.
alchemical or medical sign for alum: a simple circle. Unicode references a different glyph for this meaning.
alchemical sign for alum, alternative form; horizontally divided circle with + attached to left side. Unicode references a different glyph for this meaning.
alchemical symbol for antimony. Unicode attaches both 'earth' and 'antimony' to the same (earth) codepoint. TCP separates into two entities.
alchemical or medical sign for aqua regis or aqua regia: resembles a stylized conjoined AR
alchemical or medical sign for arsenic: two small circles joined at their midpoints by horizontal line (sometimes curved up or down, hijacking symbol for north or south node)
alchemical or medical sign for arsenic: two small circles joined at their midpoints by vertical line, or attached, forming an 8-shaped symbol, usu tilted to the right.
alchemical sign for ashes; resembles capital E with + attached at central left

alchemical or medical sign for bezoar minerale (a preparation of antimony); resembles the astrological sign for Leo (in our only example, printer presumably hijacked the available glyph). DISPLAY AS LEO (U+264C)
alchemical or medical sign for blood; resembles a down-pointing triangle bisected horizontally by a line and with a dot in the upper half
alchemical sign for cinnabar, glyph resembles barbed fishhook or two yoghs transected by horizontal line.
alchemical sign for cinnabar, alternative form; downward-pointing open triangle surmounted by +

equiv.desc: ALCHEMICAL SYMBOL FOR SALT OF ANTIMONY (i.e. cinnabar)

char.comment: alchemical sign for cinnabar, alternative form; horizontally divided circle with upper half vertically divided, surmounted by +

alchemical or medical sign for day: resembles a small circle with a vertical line sticking up from it (vertically or slanted to the right), conjunction (U+260C). Unicode attaches both 'conjunction' and 'day' to this 'conjunction' codepoint. TCP separates these senses into two entities.
alchemical symbol for earth as an element, different from Earth as a planet, For the latter, cp. Earth, antimony
alchemical symbol for fire as an element
alchemical sign for glass; circle with horizontal line attached externally at center right
alchemical or medical sign for drop (minim), using the zodiacal sign for Scorpio (U+264F). Display as U+264F.
alchemical or medical sign for drop (minim), using the zodiacal sign for Virgo (U+264D). Display as U+264D.
alchemical or medical sign for night: resembles a small circle with a vertical line sticking down from it (vertically or slanted to the left).
alchemical symbol for nitre or saltpetre
alchemical symbol for oil
alchemical or medical sign for oil, glyph variant resembling two concentric circles. DISPLAY AS CIRCLED WHITE BULLET (U+29BE).

equiv.desc: ALCHEMICAL SYMBOL FOR ORPIMENT or AURIPIGMENTUM

char.comment: alchemical or medical sign for orpiment or auripigmentum, probably in most cases yellow orpiment (arsenic trisulphide) though possibly sometimes red orpiment (arsenic monosulphide). Resembles two circles side by side tied together by a pair of horizontal lines. Glyph variant is a pair of horzontal lines with symmetrical central bulges.
alchemical or medical sign for potash: resembles a squared-off U with an attached + below it

alchemical or medical sign for purify or purifies; formally various; apparently resembles a U-shaped loop with small loops or circes at each end (a little like an ascending node sign, which is sometimes substituted)

alchemical sign for quicklime; glyph variants reflect various printers' expedients; one version resembles circle containing + (i.e. both horizontally and vertically divided), with another + attached externally at lowest point (?could display as U+2295 U+031F); another (the canonical version) a U-shaped cup surmounting a cross; another a Greek capital Psi (apparently a hijacked glyph).
alchemical sign for retort as a piece of lab equipment.

alchemical symbol for sal armoniac, possible alternative form
alchemical symbol for salt
alchemical sign for salt gemme (sal gemmae, rock salt); resembles Taurus sign. Display as Taurus, U+2649
alchemical or medical sign caput mortuum (death's head or skull). DISPLAY AS SKULL AND CROSSBONES (U+2620).
alchemical symbol for sulphur
alchemical sign for talc(k); resembles capital X.

equiv.desc: ALCHEMICAL SYMBOL FOR TARTAR (i.e. impure potassium tartrate)

char.comment: alchemical symbol for tartar or potassium tartrate
alchemical sign for urine; resembles open square or open square with central dot. Display as squared dot operator: U+22A1
alchemical or medical sign for verdigris (a mixture of copper salts); resembles the alchemical sign for sal ammoniac (in our only example, printer presumably hijacked the available glyph).

alchemical or medical sign for distilled vinegar or spirit of vinegar: a simple cross (?either + or x shaped) with dots in the four quadrants, like U+205C (which is not included in Arial Unicode MS). Unicode 1F703 has the right glyph and similar enough meaning (alternate glyph for VINEGAR) to make entity and codepoint equivalent.
alchemical or medical sign for vinegar: a simple cross (?either + or x shaped)
alchemical symbol for vitriol (sulphuric acid, or its products iron, copper, or zinc sulfate); vertically divided circle with right half horizontally divided but no attachments external to circle
alchemical sign for vitriol; alternative form, horizontally divided circle with + attached to right side

alchemical sign for vitriol (or chalcantum vitriolum, blue vitriol or copper sulphate); alternative form, vertically divided circle, right half also horizontally divided, with + attached to right side
alchemical symbol for water as an element
alchemical or medical sign for wax: resembles a small circle with four symmetrical rays
chemical or alchemical sign, possibly for magnesia/um (based on symbols.com). Resembles circle with cross or arrow attached to right side.
angle symbol
math. Mark that identifies following listed points as defining an angle, physically rendered as horizontal brace or similar mark, Cp. ang

mathematical symbol for arc resembling a semicircle. Use this entity regardless of orientation of character. Unicode form is top half of circle; attested form in EEBO is left half of circle or strange tall C
decimal separator symbol resembling small letter c or mirror image of (comma-like) Arabic decimal separator
decimal separator symbol resembling lower left box-drawing character (L), sometimes extended under decimal portion of number. Use without surrounding spaces.
mathematical symbol for divisor or divided by (formally identical to eccentric greater than symbol (entity morethan), ⫍ SQUARE LEFT OPEN BOX OPERATOR displays as box
mathematical symbol for higher or more acute term (open triangle pointing up with horizontal stroke below), ⩟ LOGICAL AND WITH UNDERBAR displays as box
mathematical symbol for higher or more acute (open triangle pointing up)
left hand (mirrored) form of angle symbol
lazy-s character or reversed tilde, symbolizing 200 or difference
math. Defined as 'minus [quam]' unusual form of less than used with angles (may filter to lt)
mathematical symbol for logarithm
mathematical symbol for lower or graver term (open triangle pointing down with horizontal stroke above)
mathematical symbol for lower or graver than (open triangle pointing down)
math. Defined as 'maius [quam]' unusual form of greater than used with angles (may filter to gt)
mathematical symbol for multiplier or multiplied by (resembles m followed by tilde)
mathematical symbol of potestas or power (perhaps a form of powerof1 entity)
mathematical symbol for root or quantity to the first power
mathematical symbol for square or quadrat or quantity to the power of two
mathematical symbol for cube or quantity to the power of three
mathematical symbol for square of square (foursquared quadrat or quadrat of quadrat) or quantity to the power of four
mathematical symbol for sursolid or quantity to the power of five
mathematical symbol for squared cube (quadrat of cube) or quantity to the power of six
penta-prime (five prime marks), follos prime, Prime (double prime), tprime (triple prime), qprime (quadra-prime)). Not in Unicode.
mathematical symbol for multiplication product (resembles m with superscripted i or acute)
four dots arranged in square (like two colons) meaning 'proportion' or 'proportional to'. Not quaddot entity.
mathematical symbol for continued proportion
quadruple prime
mathematical symbol for quotient (resembles divisor with slight hook)
colon used in mathematical sense of ratio
mathematical symbol for ratio(n) (a special use of the Rx symbol)
reversed roman numeral C
reversed roman numeral c
roman numeral 10000 (doubled M)
roman numeral 100000 (tripled M)
roman numeral 1000000 (quadrupled M)
roman numeral 5000 (doubled D)
roman numeral 50000 (tripled D)
roman numeral 500000 (quadrupled D)
mathematical symbol for surd root or radical (a special use of the Rx symbol). {root}Q is square root {root}C is cube root etc.
musical barline, formally similar to single verticle bar (verbar)
musical double barline, formally similar to double vertical bar (Verbar)
final barline or close, glyph variant of musical barline (U+1D100).
May be same as timeimperf-prolatimperf
Looks like reversed cut time symbol. May be the same as timeimperf-prolatimperf-rev-str
Appears to be 'cut time'; may be same as timeimperf-prolatimperf-str
musical direct symbol (resembles check mark)
musical symbol fermata (cadence or close). Used also for holds.
musical symbol fermata below (cadence or close). Used also for holds.
musical left repeat symbol resembles ||:
musical brace, formally similar to left curly brace
musical bracket, formally similar to left square bracket
generic musical note symbol. Display as dingbat-type quarter note (U+2669)
musical symbol breve or brief note or nota brevis
musical symbol crotchet note or nota minima black
musical symbol demisemiquaver note, 𝅘𝅥𝅰 MUSICAL SYMBOL THIRTY-SECOND NOTE displays as box.
For display purposes substitute the dingbat eighth-note for the true musical eighth-note (which most fonts do not support).
musical symbol large note or double long note or nota maxima
musical symbol long note or nota longa
musical symbol minim note or nota minima white (black 𝆺𝅥)
For display purposes substitute the dingbat quarter-note for the true musical quarter-note (which most fonts do not support).
musical symbol quaver note or nota semiminima black (white 𝆹𝅥𝅮)
musical symbol semibreve or semibrief note or nota semibrevis white (black 𝆺)
musical symbol semiquaver note or nota fusa black (white 𝆹𝅥𝅯)
musical repeat symbol resembles :||: (not in Unicode except as combination of 𝄈, 𝄁, and 𝄈), 𝄈 MUSICAL SYMBOL REPEAT DOTS displays as box.
musical symbol breve or brief rest or rest commensurate with nota brevis
musical symbol crotchet rest or rest commensurate with nota minima black
musical symbol demisemiquaver rest, 𝅀 MUSICAL SYMBOL THIRTY-SECOND REST displays as box.
musical symbol large rest or rest comensurate with nota maxima
musical symbol long rest or rest comensurate with nota longa
musical symbol minim rest or rest commensurate with nota minima white
musical symbol quaver rest or rest commensurate with nota semiminima black, 𝄾 MUSICAL SYMBOL EIGHTH REST displays as box.
musical symbol semibreve or semibrief rest or rest commensurate with nota semibrevis white
musical symbol semiquaver rest or rest commensurate with nota fusa black, 𝄿 MUSICAL SYMBOL SIXTEENTH REST displays as box.
musical right repeat symbol resembles :||

musical sharp symbol, x-shaped variant form; possibly ancestor of modern double sharp; use this entity regardless of which meaning it has; use this entity if shape is roughly like x; later versions resemble modern sharp symbol. for modern #-shaped sharp (with horizontal strokes), use ISO entity sharp, 𝄪 MUSICAL SYMBOL DOUBLE SHARP (but display U+266F, ♯).

musical sharp symbol resembling mirror image of modern natural symbol (Use for p/d-shaped symbol regardless of whether it equates to a sharp or a natural; for b/q-shaped symbol use ISO natur entity), U+1D1CF MUSICAL SYMBOL CROIX.

equiv.desc: MUSICAL SYMBOL BEGIN SLUR MUSICAL SYMBOL END SLUR

char.comment: (combining) musical character treated as two characters in Unicode, non-displayable. For display purposes substitute the single LIGATURE TIE (COMBINING DOUBLE BREVE BELOW) combined with non-breaking spaces to make it a spacing character. Capture as slur regardless of whether it appears above (curved down) or below (curved up), since these are positional glyph variants.

in dance instructions: repeat preceding strain twice.
in dance instructions: repeat preceding strain thrice.
in dance instructions: designates male dancer; repurposing of symbol for Sun (or gold); display as Sun.
in dance instructions: designates female dancer; repurposing of symbol for Moon (or silver; display as FIRST QUARTER MOON.

char.comment: Greek capital letter rho with rough

Note that this koppa is the modern numeric sign, which may or may not be derived from the obsolete ancient koppa. 03DF is a recent addition to Unicode which displaced the original koppa (03DE) to status as a capital letter, but the original is more widely available in fonts, which is why 03DF is set here to display as 03DE. For the archaic forms see U+03D8 (capital), U+03D9 (small). Add entities for these if necessary. See http://ptolemy.tlg.uci.edu/~opoudjis/unicode/numerals.html.

U+03DB is the modern Greek symbol for 6, but as a recent addition to Unicode, it displaced 03DA, which it treats as a capital, though 03DA is more widely found in fonts. Hence 03DB is here set to display as 03DA. Use 03DB for numeric use if shape is vaguely like final sigma or cursive s-t ligature (origin of the name stigma). If form is like digamma or like upper half of box (gamma facing mirror gamma), use small digamma (diggr).
We have hijacked this Unicode code point for use in the XML derivative versions ONLY, as a display equivalent for an EOL hyphen.
We have hijacked this Unicode code point for use in the XML derivative versions ONLY, as a display equivalent for an editor-supplied EOL hyphen.

equiv.desc: BOX DRAWING LIGHT DOUBLE DASH HORIZONTAL

char.comment: We have hijacked this Unicode code point for a symbol to represent the spacing dash used to space words out under musical notes or similar environments.
